intro: Acronema chinense var. chinense, commonly known as Chinese acronema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and used in traditional herbal medicine.
